subject: Fashion
title: Drag's Influence on Mainstream Fashion
description: A 60-second lesson on Drag's Influence on Mainstream Fashion.

hook.text: Drag Race contestants spend $10,000+ per season on custom outfits. Designers now seek them out.

buildup.text: Drag has always pushed fashion's limitsâ€”exaggerated silhouettes, bold makeup, impossible glamour.

discovery.text: Designers like Thierry Mugler and Jean Paul Gaultier openly drew from drag aesthetics for their shows.

twist.text: Contouring, the makeup technique used by millions, was popularized by drag queens decades before YouTube.

climax.text: What mainstream fashion calls 'editorial' or 'avant-garde,' drag culture just calls Tuesday.

punchline.text: Drag didn't copy fashion. Fashion copied drag.

quiz.question: Which widely popular beauty technique was first developed and popularized by drag queens?
options: Contouring, now mainstream through social media tutorials
False eyelash application for everyday wear
Lip liner overlining for a fuller pout
